intro: Strychnos spinosa subsp. lokua, commonly known as the Lokua tree, is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is native to parts of Africa, particularly Tanzania and Kenya. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in moist, tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by orange-red berries. The berries contain seeds that are dispersed by animals, contributing to the plant's ecological role in its native habitat.
